summary: A version of Two-handed rebalance by machinocracy with a tweak to the final DPS for two handed weapons to bring them closer to the dps in the vanilla version, while retaining the new benefits.
descriptionHtml:
Firstly, this is not really my own work; It\'s only a minor re-balancing of machinocracy\'s mod \'Two-handed rebalance\'

If you haven\'t seen his mod, I strongly recommend you go and check that out first: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11159]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11159[/url]

If nothing else, you should at least read his readme since done a fair amount of work into explaining why his mod was necessary.


[b]Why this version[/b]

I really loved the original mod.  I\'ve always loved 2h weapons in this kind of game but always felt that skyrim\'s 2h weapons were just a bit too slow and unweildy.  Invariably 2h combat just ended up as an exchange of blows since you could never finish a strike fast enough to block any incoming attack, and evasion was extremely difficult for the same reason.  Machinocracy\'s mod, although quite simple, really brought 2h combat back to life.

But I always felt it was just a little too much like cheating.  Even on master mode it felt just a tiny be too easy.


[b]What does this version do?[/b]

[b]It reduces the damage awarded by each level of the barbarian perk by 5%.[/b]

Two-handed rebalance increases speed of 2h attacks by 30%, increasing the overall DPS by 30%.  While 2-handed swords should have a higher dps than a single 1 handed sword, I think 30% more is a bit too much.  30% extra damage would be equivalent to a dual-weild setup, but there are many non-dps benefits in using 2h over dual weild (you can block, stagger-locking).

[b]At top level, barbarian will now award 75% extra damage. (or 1.75 * base instead of 2.0 * base)[/b]
[b]Original version: 2.0 * 1.3 = base dps multiplied by 2.6 by perks[/b]
[b]This Version: 1.75 * 1.3 = base dps multiplied by 2.275 by perks[/b]
[b]Vanilla Version: 2.0 * 1 = base dps multiplied by 2 by perks[/b]
author: Layam
